result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Robert Jordan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey Robert Jordan in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Jeffrey Robert Jordan.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court on behalf of Annie Louk for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discovery issues put forth on the record. Defense counsel requests a status conference date. Court grants request and sets 11/29/2022 deadline to file any motions by 08:00 am. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey Robert Jordan appeared by video.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Jeffrey Robert Jordan.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Finkley. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed; defense given a copy. State read the information into the record. Defense entered a plea not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey Robert Jordan appeared by video, in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Jeffrey Robert Jordan.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness on vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey Robert Jordan in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness was present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jeffrey Robert Jordan in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Jeffrey Robert Jordan in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
